name: Parallels Virtual Machine (Virtualization Framework Based)
summary: A MACVM file contains a virtual machine created by Parallels Desktop for Mac, a virtualization application for Macs that can run other operating systems (OSs). It is a macOS package , similar to a .PVM file, but is created by installations of Parallels Desktop on Macs with Apple silicon chips (instead of Intel processors) that support the ARM architecture using Apple's virtualization framework. MACVM files store all of the virtual machine components required by Parallels Desktop for Mac to load and run an OS, such as Windows or macOS.

open.note: Open with an associated app listed below.
